intro: Opulaster glabratus, commonly known as the smooth opulaster, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple. Opulaster glabratus is typically found in moist, tropical environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
